intro: Setiechinopsis mirabilis, commonly known as the desert bell, is a flowering plant native to arid regions of southern Africa. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant features a tall, erect stem with narrow, gray-green leaves that are covered in fine hairs to reduce water loss. Its showy, yellow-orange flowers bloom in late summer, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Setiechinopsis mirabilis is well adapted to harsh environments, with deep roots and a slow growth rate to conserve resources.
